Several studies have investigated the effects of the environmental conditions on the corrosion of alloys used in dental prostheses.
14 The alloys intended for intraoral use should be resistant to corrosion and chemical degradation.
15 The alloys utilized in the oral cavity have been reported to leach heavy metals in the saliva under normal conditions. In an in vitro study, metal ion leaching was indicated to be pH-dependent. In another study, Ni and Cr were reported to leach out of metal alloys; however, molybdenum and carbon were more stable.
